Package org.efaps.init

Class from this package should be only used if no J2EE server is used to initialize the database connection and store binding.

See: Description

    Interface Description

    TODO comment!
    INamingBinds
    The interface is used to define the names of the bindings.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    StartupDatabaseConnection
    Initialize the database connection for an eFaps instance.
    Util
    Utility class for the init package to startup database connections and stores.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    StartupException
    Exception which is thrown if the database connection or store binding could not initialized correctly.

Package org.efaps.init Description

Class from this package should be only used if no J2EE server is used to initialize the database connection and store binding. E.g. if a shell is implemented, the shell does not have a J2EE server... To define the database connection, three naming bindings must exists:
INamingBinds.RESOURCE_DBTYPE
Holds the instance of the Database Type. The implementing class must be derived from AbstractDatabase.
INamingBinds.RESOURCE_DATASOURCE
Holds the instance of the SQL data source. The class must implement interface DataSource.
INamingBinds.RESOURCE_TRANSMANAG
Holds the instance of the Transaction Manager. The class must implement interface TransactionManager.
